title: Beau Fermor
text:
Beau Fermor (born 15 August 1998) is an Australian professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a for the <a href="Gold%20Coast%20Titans">Gold Coast Titans</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a>.
Background.
Born in <a href="Dalby%2C%20Queensland">Dalby, Queensland</a>, Fermor played his junior rugby league for the Dalby Devils.
Playing career.
In 2014, Fermor played for the <a href="Toowoomba%20Clydesdales">Toowoomba Clydesdales</a> <a href="Cyril%20Connell%20Cup">Cyril Connell Cup</a> side, moving up to their <a href="Mal%20Meninga%20Cup">Mal Meninga Cup</a> side a year later before being signed by the <a href="Melbourne%20Storm">Melbourne Storm</a>. In 2016, he played for Melbourne's <a href="NRL%20Under-20s">under-20</a> side, playing 27 games over two seasons, scoring 11 tries. 
In 2018, Fermor signed with the <a href="Newcastle%20Knights">Newcastle Knights</a>, joining their <a href="Jersey%20Flegg%20Cup">Jersey Flegg Cup</a> side. In July 2018, he represented the <a href="Queensland%20under-20%20rugby%20league%20team">Queensland under-20</a> side in their win over New South Wales. At the end of the 2018 season, Fermor was named the Jersey Flegg Cup Player of the Year and signed a two-year extension with the Newcastle club. In 2019, he spent the season playing for the Knights' <a href="NSW%20Cup">NSW Cup</a> side.
2020.
On 30 January, Fermor was granted a release by Newcastle and signed with the <a href="Gold%20Coast%20Titans">Gold Coast Titans</a> on a three-year deal.
In Round 8 of the <a href="2020%20NRL%20season">2020 NRL season</a>, Fermor made his NRL debut against the <a href="Cronulla-Sutherland%20Sharks">Cronulla-Sutherland Sharks</a>, replacing the injured <a href="Kevin%20Proctor">Kevin Proctor</a>.
2021.
Fermor played 15 games for the Gold Coast in the <a href="2021%20NRL%20season">2021 NRL season</a> including the club's elimination final loss against the <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Sydney Roosters</a>.
